page.title: 06Lound Village Store
page.content: The village store in Lound is also the Post Office. It is owned by Mr. Searby who has run it for eleven years. It sells many different things such as meat, bread, milk, fruit, vegetables, canned goods, icecreams, sweets, crisps, bottled drinks, tobacco, cigarettes, newspapers, comics, magazines, cards and wrapping paper. Outside the shop is a post box and a telephone box. There is also a notice -board which is well used by village people. Mr. Searby gets most of his goods from Nurden and Peacock in Oulton Broad and from a wholesaler in Great Yarmouth. He thinks his prices are reasonable for a village store.
